metadata.title: CVE-2013-2298 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in the XML parser in BOINC 7.x allowattackers to have unspecified impact via a crafted XML file, related to thescheduler.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2298` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

boinc - 7.2.42+dfsg-1
boinc-client - 7.2.42+dfsg-1
boinc-client-fglrx - 7.2.42+dfsg-1
boinc-client-nvidia-cuda - 7.2.42+dfsg-1
boinc-client-opencl - 7.2.42+dfsg-1
boinc-manager - 7.2.42+dfsg-1
boinc-screensaver - 7.2.42+dfsg-1
libboinc-app7 - 7.2.42+dfsg-1
libboinc7 - 7.2.42+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: boinc package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.2.42+dfsg-1').
